properties.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 12 at 6:02AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE
FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER.

THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER IN SALT LAKE CITY HAS
ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH.

* TIMING...FROM 6 AM MST THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST MONDAY.

* AFFECTED AREA...THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTHERN UTAH NORTH OF I-80,
INCLUDING THE NORTHERN WASATCH MOUNTAINS AND BEAR RIVER RANGE.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...THE AVALANCHE DANGER FOR THE WATCH AREA WILL
RISE TO HIGH TONIGHT, WITH VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS
LIKELY ON MONDAY.

* REASON/IMPACTS...HEAVY SNOW AND DRIFTING FROM STRONG WEST WINDS
WILL CREATE WIDESPREAD AREAS OF UNSTABLE SNOW. BOTH HUMAN
TRIGGERED AND NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY. AVOID TRAVEL IN
AVALANCHE TERRAIN. STAY OFF AND OUT FROM UNDER SLOPES STEEPER
THAN 30 DEGREES.

BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG
OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.

THIS WATCH DOES NOT APPLY TO SKI AREAS WHERE AVALANCHE HAZARD
REDUCTION MEASURES ARE PERFORMED.
